An "Eventually-Astrocade" project.  I got Keith Robinson of Intellivision P=
roiduciton to go on a final discussion of producing a Netrogames Intellivis=
ion.  Netrogames, as described on netrogames.com <http://netrogames.com/> i=
s a way of turning classic games online so all games for the old system wor=
k online, assuming you=E2=80=99re in a 2400 km range.  The secret is beatin=
g 8ms of ping time, which can be done with Sprint Direct Connect.

I talked=
 with Davison Inventor=E2=80=99s group a long time ago.   They only accept =
the top 1% of inventions that can potentially make money for them.   Before=
 I was talking to Keith, a Daniel Karetski at Davison like the idea enough,=
 where if I=E2=80=99m willing to pay a <$800 pre production fee and a $6k-$=
15k prototyping fee, which includes all the science and research to make th=
is happen. All they ask is a small percentage to be negotiated.   Keith sai=
d it=E2=80=99s cheaper to produce Netrogames with this cost structure, than=
 it would be to produce a single Intelliviiosn 2-player title to be online,=
 and with this, ALL Games, INTV owned games, INTV Third Party games, and ga=
mes for other systems who want to cooperate with us, whihc gives Intellivis=
ion productions and me an additional revenue boost.

The only reason I put =
an INTV related post in the Astrocade mail fourm is becuase the Astrocade w=
ould be able to benefit from this design.   With the hundreds of multiplaye=
r games if you count Bally Basic titles could be turned online.  Besides, p=
eople are looking for new Astrocades anyway because old Astrocades are bein=
g dead due to neglect (the plush carpet of doom) , so might as well add Net=
rogames and have both an Astrocade you can play locally, or play online wit=
h 100% compatible Astrocade hardware. (Not truly original becuase network f=
eatures are added.)
--Apple-Mail=_29D47C9B-2701-48AA-BB9D-7AB4818CF377
